bow: rant hate being judged ok every parent raises their child differently and am tired of getting told what am doing wrong by family and strangers was shopping and my month old dropped his toy on the ground and picked it up and gave it back to him the lady in line behind me was like that is gross started laughing because her son was chewing on her purse strap told her to myob and checked out and walked off family member of mine was horrified that left my son watch educational cartoons like disney junior her son is almost and has never slept on his own which is fine if your co sleeping but she admits to hating it and not being able to control him she has to buy him toy every time they go out just to get him through shopping trip do care how she raises her son but he did poke my son in the eyeball when he was trying to sleep and then lied about it just am tired of moms being judgmental we all are different all parent different unless your doing something harmful or they ask your advice why ca everyone just relax edit have no problem with cosleeping did it when was breastfeeding was pointing out she hates sleeping with him and admits to failing and she uses her age as an excuse for her bad parenting which find annoying know sound judgy and am more just trying to get it out sorry if ruffled feathers everyone judges it is human to judge in your mind but think it is strange to speak up about it to stranger just trying to make yourself look better or cause conflict hear you wish we could band together as mothers and leave the judgement out my daughter threw complete fit while changed her in the bathroom while we were at the pool the other day woman just sat there and glared at me she she hates those changing tables we all know it can be hard or crazy support each other hugs it does sound that you are judging them as well… if parents did need to feel like they are doing what best for their own kids there would be no consideration of what other people are doing thus no comparison thus no opinion and no judgment as parents we have to judge what other parents do as we all slowly learn how to be parents it like we are all in class with no teachers but million assignments and one final with no due dates but it has to be done asap basically we are trying to learn from one another and if someone makes face at you it okay sometimes people make faces at her wholly accept that am judged people do like how do things and totes cool with it my own family used wildly different techniques and they feel good about them so they do understand why doing my own thing and am fucking down with that and hey if my mom was so proud of how turned out she would care as much that doing things differently than she did that how people cope with overwhelming responsibility and loose guidance like learning how to drive we learned by watching and contemplating how other people around us are doing it do see where she said that they were making parenting fails do get why it is competition or where experienced moms think they know more about your kid than you do or if they try to dictate how you are going to raise your child no you do what works for you and your baby they can mind their business and their manners you do have to explicitely say the words judging you to judge someone you know think parents end up judging everything other parents do because we spend most of our free time taking care of our children so we do have much else to talk about she did appear to be judging she was pointing out that the other parent was being rude and saying things when she should have been and the little kid was mean to her baby gt started laughing because her son was and gt her son is almost and has never slept on his own which is fine if your co sleeping **but** she has to buy him toy every time they go out just to get him through shopping trip do care how she raises her son **but** yeah it sounds like just defensive reaction but she definitely being judgmental of others as well do as say not as do right the way understood it is do like when people judge me for how raise my children especially those who think are doing worst job than me at being parents ranting on forum or internally disapproving of someone parenting choices is lot different than confronting said parent and telling them they re doing something wrong the title says rant so guessing op is worried too much about semantics sure we re all guilty of judging others but keeping that judgement to ourselves is behavior more of us should aspire to practice do agree with what you say was just pointing out the ironic title think to an extent people judge others but no one likes being dictated on what they need to do or have rude things said to them especially at to someone is rude do know why she would point out that the other person is co sleeping with year old it really is that unusual either if you have kid scared of the dark or something it sounds like and would be better served by the members of this forum to receive some support rather than have her words dissected understand this just think op would have even noticed or cared that the kid was aappublications org content 128 1040 full agree with you op our child is still cooking and everyone seems to think that they need to give us advice on everything it gets old after while everyone parents differently and just because someone does something different way does mean it wrong it just different op says she hates being judged mommit hordes swoop down in judgement got ta love reddit *sigh* there no such thing as educational tv where infants and toddlers are concerned do think little tv is going to hurt your baby but do be fooled by the marketing personally find it very strange this idea the expectation that person is owed judgment free environment least their bliss be disturbed it presumes world free of consequences world where the link between cause and effect is ignored for the sake of convenience and the preservation of one positive viberations ll admit there are certain things get judgey about am not proud of that side of myself and try to curb it and do tell other people how to handle their business even if think it at times know am not perfect before became mom was at grocery store picking up some things with my mom late at night and saw young couple with toddler made some judgemental comment about parents having their kids out so late and my mom told me not to judge people do know she said did know their situation maybe they worked all day and could only shop at night maybe they were on their way home from long trip and needed milk there were any number of reasons why they might be out and it was fair to judge them try to think of that when want to judge completely agree but do you know better was kind of condescending way to phrase it do think we re disagreeing on that point gt it sounds like just defensive reaction but she definitely being with it when it comes to parenting if experience parent allowing child to do something that adversely affects me or my child going to say something depending on that parent demeanor can be nice about learning to put down the weapon and opt out of the war even if that means another mom judges you and you could so easily judge her back just do we all judge expect judgment but just would voice it out right it is human to judge no one is perfect but to say things to stranger or admit your failure then try to tell me am failing or just ignorance once confronted guy in parking lot after finding his alarming him and tried to be polite and explained that it does have to be scorching outside for the temperature inside the car to get dangerous quickly he probably drove away thinking what nosy bitch do what you think is right for you and your family always the regrets you have will be minimal and screw everyone else who thinks you could have done it better well pretty sure everyone would judge
